attributes.action: make a pass card for parent and child parking like disabled to stop misuse
attributes.background: It's not about being close to the shops it's about having the extra room to open the doors fully to get children in and out of the car easier and not damaging other people's cars. It's also a safety factor for children as well. I want cars to display a pass similar to a disabled pass as proof
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are abusing these spaces that don't have children because they are too lazy to park a car further down the car park. As a parent it is very difficult to get a push chair and child out of a normal sized car space. 
To park in a parent and child space you should display a pass like disabled do if you don't have one you should recieve a fine like people do in a disabled space that don't display a pass

Better control is needed for the safety of children and other peoples property

attributes.action: Make not paying a taxi/private hire soiling fee a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Why is the soiling fee not a criminal offence when not paying the fare on the meter is a criminal offence.

So many times drivers are put off the road while they get there car cleaned and back up to standard, why should the driver be out of pocket when it was no fault of the driver.

attributes.action: Student nurses & midwives should get paid for hrs worked if bursary is scrapped
attributes.background: if the NHS bursary is scrapped, student nurses and midwives should get paid for any hours worked while training. Because currently the bursary is available and nurses and midwives work for free.

attributes.action: Grant an amnesty to all illegal immigrants living in the UK prior to 23.06.2016.
attributes.background: Following Britain's decision to leave the EU, many people fear a significant shift to the right and violence against foreign nationals living in Britain. To prevent the victimisation of illegal immigrants by right-wing radicals, they need to have the full protection of the law as British citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Illegal immigrants are already victimised in many ways, for example by being indebted to people traffickers, enslaved as sweatshop workers, and exploited as sex workers. This situation can only worsen if Britain's exit from the EU is understood as a victory for a xenophobes and racists. Granting amnesty to illegal immigrants would provide them with a way out of their current servitude and save them from the aggression of right-wing thugs.

attributes.action: Ban animal dissection In all UK primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: As a student who is obliged to take part in these "experiments", I am able to stand up and protest against cruelty. I am aware that many children are upset and disturbed by dissection, but would not have the confidence to refuse to participate and confront their teachers on the matter.
attributes.additional_details: We live in a society that thrives off advanced technology, therefore we should be taking advantage of all the opportunities available from this privilege. We are no longer restricted to text books and the cruel, unnecessary practices such as dissection; other methods such as sophisticated computer software are available and have been shown to teach anatomy and complex biological processes. This is the perfect chance to leave a controversial and cruel practice in the past.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed freight hub at Gailey destroying our greenbelt land!
attributes.background: Government plans to build a railway freight hub on our greenbelt land are devastating our local community. We are fed up of being lied to. This is our wildlife and our peace and quiet - please get involved by signing our petition and stopping there being a 'one rule for one' culture with greenbelt!

attributes.action: Allow those born in June, July and August 1998 to vote in the EU referendum
attributes.background: Those of us born in the later academic months of 1998 (June, July and August) are just as educated and mature as those born in September to May. We will be leaving school and entering university/further education at the same time as them so why are we deemed 'too young' to vote in the EU referendum?

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of Syrian asylum seekers
attributes.background: Faisal, 18 years old, and his father Ahmad are Syrians who arrived in the UK to seek asylum in June 2015. They are both facing deportation to Hungary where they were forced to claim asylum under duress. A considerable proportion of those returned to Hungary were detained in asylum detention centres.
attributes.additional_details: The Council of Europe Commissioner for Human Rights, Nils Muižnieks, has stated that 'asylum seekers returned to Hungary run a considerable risk of being subject to human rights violations.' Also, as there are systemic flaws in the asylum procedure and in the reception conditions in Hungary, the UK is not permitted under international law to deport asylum seekers to that country. The only other option for Ahmad and his son is to return to Syria and face the risk of being killed in the conflict.

attributes.action: Explain why FCO 30/1048 was withheld from the British public for 30 years
attributes.background: In 1971, an FCO memorandum known as FCO 30/1048 was drafted. This document details how the UK would surrender sovereignty if it were to join the E.E.C/EU. However, this document was classified as Confidential, and not released into the public domain until 2002.
attributes.additional_details:
The surrender of sovereign powers, as a consequence of signing the Treaty of Rome, Maastricht, and Lisbon, is in breach of the British constitution, as detailed in the Bill of Rights 1688.

This Bill has never been repealed, and as such was and is still in force. The contents of FCO 30/1048, and the effect to UK sovereignty, were not made available to the British public during the 1975 referendum.

References:
Bill of Rights 1688
FCO 30/1048
Treaty of Rome
Maastricht Treaty
Lisbon Treaty

attributes.action: Change the Gambling Act to prevent bookmakers conning people.
attributes.background: Most Bookmakers with a UK licence routinely and on mass, ban some customers from taking part in their publicly advertised promotions. This is false advertising and conning people to gamble, then refusing without reason to honour the advertised offer and excluding them from all future offers.
attributes.additional_details: Ban Bookmakers using the term "We reserve the right to restrict or exclude people from our offers at our discretion and without notice or warning" This quite simply should not be allowed it is totally unfair and discriminating. A supermarket cannot exclude customers from its publicly advertised promotion offers, so why is a bookmaker allowed to? In other Countries, where a bookmaker makes an offer public of say "bet £25 and get £25 free" they have to honour that to everyone who takes part in it.

attributes.action: Protect whistleblowing junior doctors
attributes.background: Junior doctors who raise concerns about patient safety do not have full protection under the law, and could lose their career.  We ask that junior doctors have full whistleblowing legal protection, in the same manner as student nurses
attributes.additional_details:
In England, a junior doctor's career is controlled by a public body called Health Education England (HEE).  HEE controls long term employment, and can make decisions to remove a doctor from training.  At this moment in time, if a doctor fears they are being punished for whistleblowing, the decisions of HEE cannot be held to account in an employment tribunal.

http://www.54000doctors.org/thecase/1-intro-and-how-this-case-affects-you.html

attributes.action: Do not amend the Hunting Act using a Statutory Instrument
attributes.background:
Mr Cameron is likely to repeal the fox hunting ban through the back door using a Statutory Instrument which does not require a vote in parliament. Over 80% of the British people and most MPs don't wish to see fox hunting reintroduced.

Please sign to show your disgust in this undemocratic act.
attributes.additional_details:
Mr Cameron has said he believes in the "freedom to hunt" and wants fox hunting legalised. He will go to any lengths to achieve this including riding over the will of parliament and that of the British people.

Fox hunting involves chasing and killing a fox, on horseback, with a pack of dogs, in traditional dress. This is a vicious and outdated pastime, and the idea of repealing the ban introduced by the Labour government, so that people like Cameron can hunt and kill foxes is a horrific one.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of the Mental Health Welland Centre in Market Harborough.
attributes.background: This centre is my sole source of free support where I, like so many others, have crucial appointments with a psychiatrist. The closure of this centre means appointments would be held in Wigton. But for people who cannot drive and have anxiety when using public transport this will made be difficult.
attributes.additional_details: The wider issue here is the governments neglect of the mental health services in the United Kingdom. I realise there are probably many cases in towns, villages or cities where these centres are being closed down and I would encourage those effected by these changed to petition against them too.

attributes.action: We ask for an independent review of the validity of the EU referendum franchise.
attributes.background: Many UK expats were disenfranchised from the referendum, violating Art.21 of the UN Declaration on Human Rights. We call for an independent inquiry into the validity of the referendum electoral roll and for further government consideration of EU exit to be postponed until its finding is made public.
attributes.additional_details: UK expatriate citizens residing abroad for 15 years or more were excluded from voting in the EU referendum, in contravention of their human rights, as laid out in Article 21 of the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights of December 10, 1948 (General Assembly resolution 217(III) A). We believe this disenfranchisement to be unacceptable, since these UK citizens are among the most directly and adversely affected by the referendum outcome.

attributes.action: Ban shorting of London AIM stocks,  including shorting by Market Makers
attributes.background:
We believe that shorting stocks on the AIM is damaging to companies, private investors and to the economy. 

Manipulating a share price with borrowed stock is detrimental. Stocks should rise and fall naturally based on fundamentals and any external interference, legal or not should be addressed.
attributes.additional_details:
The purpose of AIM is to support companies looking to grow steadily through investment, In turn creating jobs.

Large orchestrated shorting attacks aren't giving companies a fair chance in an already difficult market. 

Social media and forums are often used during shorting, attempting to panic investors into selling, hence sending the price of the stock down further. 

Only shorters and Market Makers benefit from this

A simple explanation of shorting
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-14510946

attributes.action: Make 'may contain' warnings mandatory on food labels.
attributes.background: You're a parent to a child with a severe allergy. You spend time in the shop studying food labels. You give your child something you think is safe. Suddenly their lips, tongue and throat swell. They fight for breath. Lose consciousness. Where's the EpiPen? In their school bag? Quick! QUICK!
attributes.additional_details:
Food producers must show common allergens in the ingredients lists of their products, but if a product 'may contain' allergens due to cross contamination it is the manufacturer who decides whether to detail that on the label.  

For some this could be life threatening, for others it could cause weeks of discomfort. 

We ask that the Food Standards Agency ensure that consumers are made aware when there is genuine potential for traces of common allergens to be present in packaged food.

attributes.action: keep F1 (Formula 1) on free to air television
attributes.background: From 2019, Formula 1 will no longer be shown on free to air television in the UK. All rights have been purchased by Sky which means the only way to view will be by paying a monthly subscription. The British GP is the only race that will be shown for free. Please sign if you think this is unfair.

attributes.action: Create a national register of individuals banned from keeping animals.
attributes.background: Bans on keeping animals are currently unenforcible as no national register exists.  This petition argues that a national register should be created listing all individuals who have been convicted of animal cruelty and banned from keeping animals.
attributes.additional_details: The current legislation is not fit for purpose.  It is easy for an individual, previously convicted of cruelty to animals, to go out and buy another pet, perpetuating unnecessary suffering and cruelty.  A national register must exist that lists all individuals banned from keeping animals ensuring that their conviction is enforceable, and therefore meaningful.

attributes.action: Overturn NHS decision to stop children's heart surgery at Glenfield Hospital
attributes.background: My godson's life was saved by the amazing and caring staff at this hospital, as we're many more. We should be helping these places of excellence not closing these departments!

attributes.action: Grant Patrick Aganozor a VISA to donate his bone marrow to his brother
attributes.background: Patrick Aganozor is a 50% match for his brother's cell transplant who is in urgent need of bone marrow donation in order to  save him from leukaemia. Patrick - who lives in Nigeria- was a refused a visa into the Uk in April by the British High Commission. Time is running out to save Isaac...
attributes.additional_details: In August 2015 Isaac Aganozor was diagnosed with leukaemia. Isaac (44) continued to work until December 2015 when his condition deteriorated and he was no longer able to work. Isaac's hopes of fighting the disease were boosted when his brother tested as a  50% match for his brother's treatment. The British High Commissioner in Lagos, however, refused his VISA on the grounds that he was not convinced that Patrick will 'leave the Uk at the end of your stay'.If we are to save Isaac we must act now.

attributes.action: A & E, Maternity, Stroke services be maintained at the NDDH.
attributes.background:
The NHS have set up a "Success Regime" project for North & East Devon and this has given rise to fears that "red line" services such as
Accident & Emergency, Maternity and Stroke services will be withdrawn from the North Devon District Hospital.

attributes.action: Make Carer's Allowance a qualifying benefit for an NHS Exemption certificate
attributes.background: Carers looking after sick or disabled family members are often unable to work due to their caring responsibilities. Many suffer from health problems themselves due to the stress and physical demands of caring but cannot afford the expense of much needed prescriptions, dental treatment etc.

attributes.action: Make 30th july awareness day for gastroschisis.
attributes.background: Gastroschisis affects 1-3000 births. After birth surgery is needed. Gastroschisis is a hole in the abdominal wall allowing the intestines(some other organs) to form on the outside off the body.
attributes.additional_details: My daughter is 1 off these babies affected. She has long term complications and has been on medication since birth. Every case is different hospitals stays can be anything from 2 weeks-1year+ some dont make it. Alot of health professionals i have seen dont know about this condition themselves this is how unknown gastroschisis is.

attributes.action: Create Safe and free HGV parking areas across the country.
attributes.background: There are a large amount of HGV drivers parking in dodgy areas due to there being a lack of suitable free parking areas. This includes in lay-bys and industrial estates. This is putting the drivers, their goods and their vehicles at risk. Other European countries provide free parking. Why can't we?

attributes.action: Ban plastic "6 pack rings" and use biodegradable / edible alternatives
attributes.background: Over 100,000 marine animals and 1m sea birds die each year after digesting or getting stuck in plastic "6 pack rings".  I would like government to force manufacturers to use environmentally friendly alternatives / edible (for aquatic life) options.
attributes.additional_details: "6 Pack Ring" refers to the plastic rings used to keep 6 tins or cans of drink together.  As an Island nation we should take the lead to protect our shores and the animals that inhabit them.  A company in the US has developed an edible (to the aquatic life) alternative made using grains from the brewing process.  The rings we use now are photodegradable but can take up to 90 days to break.  Plenty of time to kill a seal, bird, turtle or other marine life that thinks it's something to eat.

attributes.action: Withdraw proposals for a devolved East Anglia, i.e. Cambs, Norfolk and Suffolk.
attributes.background: It is fundamentally undemocratic to change the nature of our local democracy without full consultation with the people who will be effected by the proposals. The proposals should be temporarily withdrawn until such time as due consultation and a referendum have been held.
attributes.additional_details:
Where is the accountability, democracy and transparency in these proposals?
Were these proposals put to the people at the 2015 General Election?
What evidence is there that showing the electorate support such changes?

attributes.action: Extend Coroner jurisdiction to examine unexpected Stillbirth in Labour\Delivery
attributes.background:
There are over 3600 Stillbirths each yr in the UK, with 6-in-10 of these deaths being considered potentially avoidable.

We ask;
- All unexpected Stillbirths during Labour\Delivery are independently reviewed by a Coroner for Inquest
- Local Trusts share Stillbirth statistics with Coroners Office
attributes.additional_details:
'Clara's Law' Campaign has been started following the Inquest of Clara Tully Hardman who was initially classed as Stillborn. During the Inquest several practice, procedural & training issues were identified across various NHS services which prompted changes to limit risk of re-occurrence, thus preventing further tragedies occurring.

Recommendations have been made in the Morecambe Bay Kirkup Report, by Coroners, Pathologists and by Dr Alan Fletcher which recommend reviewing current legislation.

attributes.action: Consider a vote of no confidence in David Cameron
attributes.background: In the light of the recent revelations about the Panama Papers, and his lack of clarity regarding personal involvement, his record on aspects of tax avoidance policy create questions over, for example, his competence at handling such issues.

attributes.action: Sufferers of rare cancers to have free access to new cutting edge treatments
attributes.background: Petition The Right Honorable Jeremy Hunt to persuade NICE to allow sufferers of rare cancers to have free access to new cutting edge treatments that are freely available to sufferers of more common cancers, such as Melanoma. My wife Beryl has a very rare Small Cell Carcinoma of the Ovary.
attributes.additional_details: Following 13 cycles of chemotherapy Beryl is now undergoing an experimental course of immunotherapy in the form of "Pembrolizumab".  Had Beryl been suffering from Melanoma she would have been able to access Pembrolizumab for free on the NHS. Although NICE have licensed Pembrolizumab for Melanoma, it is not licensed for her type of cancer. There are not enough sufferers to support a formal trial. We find the decision not to fund Beryl's, and other rare cancer sufferers', care very unjust.

attributes.action: Exclude the Armed Forces core meal provision from the 20% VAT rate
attributes.background:
While the last review left the Daily Food Charge set at £4.79, from October the 1st the cost of a core meal at a Pay As You Dine facility will increase to £5.75 to account for VAT at the 20% rate.

No VAT should be paid on core meal provisions or proper cooking facilities should be provided.
attributes.additional_details:
The increase is due to PAYD facilities having to charge VAT on the DFC, which in turn reduces the amount of money left to actually provide the meal.

With little cooking facilities available to service personnel living in military accommodation, it is unfair to ask such personnel to pay the 20% VAT rate when they have little or no other options for cooking their own meal(s).

Core meal provisions are not a luxury and should not be charged as such.

attributes.action: Reopen Crawley hospital A&E
attributes.background: East Surrey hospital is over stretched and we need more hospital space.

attributes.action: Stop the Closure of Minor Injuries Units in Ely, Doddington and Wisbech
attributes.background: Cambridgeshire & Peterborough Clinical Commissioning Group want to close our essential minor injuries units and we, the undersigned, are petitioning the government to keep these invaluable units open in areas where they are needed the most

attributes.action: Law to make all company ownership transparent in UK dependencies & territories
attributes.background: As the Panama Papers prove the British Virgin Islands is one of the world's capitals of tax avoidance, evasion and money laundering. The territory has 600,000 companies registered there with a population of around 30 thousand.
attributes.additional_details:
UK parliament can enforce the following laws or impose direct rule

What would that reform be: All accounts of all companies on public record All beneficial ownership on public record, proven by a requirement that banks confirm the beneficial ownership of companies they provide services to Directorships on public record - 

See more at: http://www.taxresearch.org.uk/Blog/2016/04/05/we-can-change-the-law-in-the-uks-tax-havens-and-impose-direct-rule-if-they-dont-like-it/#sthash.ANKwMayT.FDQP9XFU.dpuf

attributes.action: Turn empty buildings into homeless shelters and housing
attributes.background:
I am Madison and I'm ten.
When I go out with my parents I am sad to see homeless people everywhere I go. They are human beings and it's cold and they deserve a home, a warm bed. It makes me cry because I think it's really unfair.
Then I see all these derelict and empty buildings,  and a solution.
attributes.additional_details:
Why should we have people in our wonderful country with no place to call home?
Why do I get to sleep in a safe and warm home whilst people are out in the cold?
Why are there so many empty houses and buildings if there are poeple who need a roof over their heads?
Why are we not fixing this?

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for all long term conditions in England.
attributes.background: It's unfair how certain long term conditions deserve free prescriptions and others do not. It's discrimination. Either we ALL pay or NON of us pay.
attributes.additional_details:
I have polycystic kidney disease and need blood pressure tablets. Twice I've been in hospital because I could not afford my medication. I am not exempt from prescription charges.
If I had a thyroid condition or diabeties I'm exempt from ALL charges. 
If I'm over 60 regardless of wealth I'm exempt from ALL charges.

This requires some serious review. I'm fighting this - please help me.

attributes.action: Do not exempt universities from Freedom of Information requests
attributes.background: The Higher Education Green Paper contains a proposal to make universities exempt from the Freedom of Information Act, on page 68. This is incredibly dangerous for maintaining transparency and for student media who rely on FOI requests to hold universities and other HEIs to account.
attributes.additional_details:
The Russell Group which represents 24 universities, have publicly supported this proposal: “The additional responsibilities created by FOI represent an unnecessary burden. Furthermore, changes in funding of higher education and the emergence of a private sector of higher education provision mean that continued application of the Freedom of Information Act to universities is unfair.”

It is also corroborated by Universities UK, which represents 132 vice-chancellors and principals.

attributes.action: Stop the planned closure of Children's Centres.
attributes.background: These services are vital for both parents and children. They provide a safe, friendly place for families where friendships are made, important parenting information is learnt, babies have access to toys to aid development. Losing them will cost more in the long run, financially and emotionally.
attributes.additional_details: In my local area of Kettering, Northamptonshire, we currently have seven designated venues spread over the local towns. The proposed cuts will close five of them, reduce one to operating on a part time basis and only one open full time. In an area which is growing hugely with massive new build developments including new family housing and schools. It is unfair for children and parents to miss out on the support these Centres provide. Stop the closures!!

attributes.action: Change of employment law for terminal/long term cancer carers
attributes.background: My husband is diagnosed with terminal cancer. I work full time (need to) and the only options available to me to care for him during treatment and for longer term care are 3 days compassionate leave, unpaid leave or annual leave.
attributes.additional_details: It seems wrong that someone can have maternity leave paid but when your partner is dying you are entitled to next to nothing. Given the number of people who have to work full time in order to keep the family home running during these very difficult times, employment law does not reflect this.  If we are a truly 'caring' nation then it is time this is addressed.

attributes.action: Stop bombing Syria!
attributes.background: At the moment the UK are bombing Syria killing a huge amount of innocent people. There are more efficient methods. Let's help the people of Syria and try and stop these bombings! Please take a few minutes to sign.

attributes.action: MAKE FAULTY BIRD NETTING ILLEGAL!
attributes.background:
Wild birds often get trapped in or behind netting put on buildings and under bridges as a deterrent and they suffer long, painful deaths from starvation or strangulation.
Make all netting which is faulty or not fit for purpose ILLEGAL.
If netting cannot be maintained it should be REMOVED.
attributes.additional_details:
Netting often traps birds and therefore they should be easily ACCESSIBLE for rescue. Trapped birds are protected under the 2006 Animal Welfare Act and should be released or handed to wildlife rescuers. Further, ALL wild birds, together with their nests, are protected under the 1981 Wildlife and Countryside Act. It is the responsibility of the owner of the property to ensure compliance with the law. 
There are alternative deterrents which are more humane and effective.

attributes.action: Give all members of the British Armed forces a pay rise equal to politicians.
attributes.background: The people who defend our countries interests are under valued and the job they do is undermined by such a pitiful 1% pay rise. When the government get 11%

attributes.action: Pause HMRC's office closures until the taxation impact of Brexit is understood
attributes.background:
Leaving the EU will have a major impact on the work done by HMRC; particularly VAT, Customs and International Trade. 
We call on HMRC to suspend its plans to close offices and cut jobs, until Parliament agrees the functions HMRC will need to undertake following the decision to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) plans to close 90% of its offices; and cut 9,000 more jobs by 2021
HMRC refuse to acknowledge the organisational impact of leaving the EU, saying it doesn’t change their closure plans. This threatens HMRC's future ability to collect the taxes which provide for the funding for essential services including defence, education, healthcare, policing and welfare
HMRC has already closed its office in Newry, which stands on what will be the UK's only land border with the EU

attributes.action: Declare the result of the EU referendum null & void.
attributes.background: Voters may have been influenced by false information sent to them by the Vote Leave campaign, whose campaign  leaflet claimed that the cost of UK membership of the EU is £350M per week, which is false.
attributes.additional_details:
https://fullfact.org/europe/cameron-bbcqt-eu-referendum-special-myths/
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36014941

attributes.action: Give chimmy a visitors visa so she can visit her mum before she dies.
attributes.background:
My auntie Vera was on BBC news this
Evening because she is currently at pilgrims hospice dying of cancer. Our government is currently refusing a dying woman her last request. Vera's daughter chimmy has been refused a visiting visa just to come and see her mum before she dies.
attributes.additional_details: Our government has continued to take in thousands of immigrants but won't let my auntie who has worked for the NHS for years, paid her taxes and contributed to our community have her last wish. Please sign to try and make her last wish come true ❤️

attributes.action: Lower the legal age of smear tests from 25 to 16
attributes.background: I have seen so many cervical cancer stories from people under the age of 25 and this has resulted in a tragedy. Smear tests would detect any problems related to this and action could be taken, but since the legal age is 25 this cannot be implimented.
attributes.additional_details:
Read further stories at...
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-2868392/Heartbreak-young-woman-died-cervical-cancer-23-refused-smear-test-managed-buy-family-Christmas-presents-passed-away.htmlway.html
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3207991/Mother-24-dies-cervical-cancer-turned-smear-test-young.html
 https://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/cancer-chat/thread/im-23-and-denied-a-smear-test

attributes.action: Make it easier for younger women to get sterilisation in the UK.
attributes.background: Women are encouraged to wait until they are around 30 before the NHS considers they are sure they want to be child free, in the mean time facing potential problems with various contraception methods and unplanned pregnancy. Please can women be taken more seriously with their child free  choice?

attributes.action: Stop the NHS closure of the Royal Brompton hospital heart unit.
attributes.background: The Royal Brompton hospital has helped thousands of both adults and children who are born with heart problems. The unit continues to meet all NHS standards and is a leading heart unit. They helped to save my life as a child and they still look after me. They off great support and treatment

attributes.action: Ban the export of live farmed animals
attributes.background: Since we have now decided rightly or wrongly to leave the EU, we the undersigned believe that the UK should demonstrate that we care about animal welfare and ban the export of live farmed animals.
attributes.additional_details:
In response to a prior petition, (https://petition.parliament.uk/archived/petitions/42002) the authorities stated that "To ban the trade . . . would be illegal and would undermine the principle of the free-movement of goods enshrined in the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union." 

We, the undersigned, do not believe that animals are "goods" and would like the Government to stop farmed animals raised in the UK from being sent overseas.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for glucose levels of newborns to be checked before discharge
attributes.background: The test is a simple heel prick.  It can help to indicate if your baby is  converting its milk feed into the required source of glucose. If the level is too low the body/brain cannot function sufficiently,  the baby may have seizures and fall into a coma. Stop it happening to someone else's baby.
attributes.additional_details: My daughters levels were not checked.  We were discharged and she subsequently fell into a coma and had seizures.  This has left her with damage to her brain and epilepsy. A simple test prior to leaving hospital would have shown low blood sugars and immediate attention could have prevented the ensuing damage.  I wish to prevent this happening to anyone else.

attributes.action: Demand a second Scottish referendum if the UK votes to leave the EU
attributes.background: If the majority of Scottish voters vote to remain part of the EU but the UK as a whole votes to leave on 23rd June 2016, Scotland, as a europhile country, should have another referendum on independence.
